moves.1. e4: The game opens with one of the main lines of the Ruy Lopez
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Ba4 Nf6:
Deciding to slow down I go with d6 rather than b5... 
I must say that I really don't like b5 at all, it never 
seems to deliver, cramps the queenside and increases
its vulnerability to attack!

In the Game Database 11,000 people went with b5, and only 379 with d6, go figure?
moves.7... bxc6: From my perspective I now have an extra pawn to help build a strong center, and the b-file is semi-open for my rook.
moves.8. d4:
Now he wants to dominate the center? 
Make up your mind, sir.
moves.8... exd4 9. Qxd4 O-O 10. Nc3 Bb7: The mission becomes clear: The pawn on the e-file must die!
moves.11. Bg5: Can he protect his precious e-pawn?
moves.11... c5 12. Qd3 Nd7: Forcing the bishop on g5 and discouraging his e-pawn from advancing
moves.14. Nd5: Attacking my queen and asking me to open up the e-file for his rook by taking his knight with my bishop.
moves.15. Red1:
I think the target here was my knight, and position on the 7th rank...
If 1. e5 dxe5 2. Ndf6+ Qxf6 3. Qxd7
moves.15... Re8:
No thanks...
Hello e-pawn and e-file!
moves.16. Rde1 Nf6: I feel the momentum starting to shift
moves.17. Rad1 Bxd5: I take with the bishop because it forced him to take me in return. The bishop is also threatening a2!
moves.18. exd5 Rxe1+: Grabbing the momentum and directing the game
moves.19. Rxe1 Qd7 20. Nd2 Qb5:
If you take me the e-pawn is mine and the a-pawn better watch his back...
If you don't take me, I will take you and the e-pawn is mine or maybe I'll just take the b-pawn (yeah right)...
What's it going to be?
moves.21. Nc4: Pretty good move, but that is a lot of commitment he is forcing on his Queen.
moves.21... h6: My goal is to exchange rooks... But I needed to make sure I didn't get caught with my pants down and that I didn't leave my a-pawn hanging
moves.22. Re7: I knew that is what he was going to do... but it doesn't matter!
moves.22... Re8: The c-pawn is safe... You must take me!
moves.23. Rxe8+ Qxe8: Threatening check, queen trade and taking the what? yes, the e (now d) pawn.
moves.25. Qb3: You want to trade really? I thought you'd never ask.
moves.26. axb3 Nxd5:
It's mine all mine... Hurray I win the pawn...
NOW WHAT?
moves.27. Ke2: A slow and tedious end-game begins!
moves.28... Ne6 29. c3 f5:
This was the only pawn I could move without weakening my position.
It also prevented his king from advancing and freed up my King to move forward.
moves.30. Ne3 g6: At this point I was actually considering offering a draw... My confidence just wasn't there for the win. I had my hands full covering all the different angles.
moves.32... Kf7 33. Ke2 c6: Forcing his knight to retreat, and building a support structure for my d-pawn
moves.36. Nc2: Let's not and say we did
moves.36... Ke6: Strengthening my position by getting the King in play
moves.37. Ne1: He is setting up for Nd3
moves.37... Nf6 38. Nd3 Ne4: Looking to fork with Nd2 on next move
moves.39... a5:
Much stronger position for my a-pawn
Not to mention that everything else had to stay put.
moves.40. Nf4+: A fork from the other side...
moves.40... Kf7: Careful not to block f6 for my knight to have a place retreat to if he threatens with f3
moves.41... d5: Creeping forward with yet another pawn and giving the knight another place so that the King can put more pressure on g5
moves.43... Nd6 44. Nf4 c4+: Looking to trade pawns and get my knight back in the action
moves.45. Kd4: What's this? He doesn't take... Thinks he can clean up from c5
moves.46. Kc5 Nb5:
Most importantly I am blocking the path to my a-pawn... If he takes my c-pawn I will take his c-pawn... There I can protect my d-pawn or at least trade for the knight... 

And if he takes my knight my pawn gets his queen on...

As a matter of fact as soon as King moves to get my c-pawn, I have a queen with a or b
moves.47. Nxd5+: Sure that makes sense. if 1. ...cxd5 2. Kxb5 and my pawns
moves.47... Ke5: so with Ke5 the Queen is still well within reach
moves.48... a4: Take my knight too for all I care
moves.49. Nb4: Oh oh he sees trouble in paradise
moves.49... Nxc3: Can you just take the knight already I want my queen
moves.50... a3: Avoiding b2 without support from the a-pawn. His knight was waiting to fork and make my efforts backfire
moves.51... Kf6 52. Nc5: hoping I will move the a-pawn instead of the b-pawn
moves.53... Ke7: I always move my king so he can't say check on the next move
moves.54... b1=Q: Hallelujah!!! Can you believe it... I think my head can explode now from all the pressure and conniving.
moves.55... Kf7:
I carefully move my King out of his range. 


GAME OVER!!
